meanings.definition: To defeat in a debate by presenting arguments more effectively.
meanings.sent1: She was able to outdebate her opponent with clear and logical points.
meanings.sent2: He always manages to outdebate his classmates during discussions.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outdebate the dog on who should get the last treat.
meanings.sent4: Her persuasive skills allowed her to outdebate any opposition effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: In the world of debates, the champion can outdebate anyone with ease.

meanings.sent1: Despite his young age, he can outdebate even the most experienced debaters.
meanings.sent2: She outdebated all her competitors in the regional debate competition.
meanings.sent3: The siblings constantly try to outdebate each other on various topics.
meanings.sent4: His ability to outdebate others made him a respected figure in the debating community.
meanings.sent5: The team captain can outdebate anyone with his quick thinking and strong arguments.
